com.jakewharton.byteunits

Enum BitUnit

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<BitUnit>
      • com.jakewharton.byteunits.BitUnit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ByteUnit, Serializable, Comparable<BitUnit>

    public enum BitUnit
extends Enum<BitUnit>
implements ByteUnit
    A BitUnit represents bit size at a given unit of granularity and provides utility methods to convert across units. A BitUnit does not maintain bit size information, but only helps organize and use bit size representations that may be maintained separately across various contexts.

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      BITS
      Bit unit representing one bit.
      GIGABITS
      A bit unit representing 1000 megabits.

      MEGABITS

      PETABITS

      TERABITS
      A bit unit representing 1000 gigabits.

      • convert

        public long convert(long sourceCount,
                    BitUnit sourceUnit)
        Converts the given size in the given unit to this unit. Conversions from finer to coarser granularities truncate, so lose precision. For example, converting from 999 bit to kilobits results in 0. Conversions from coarser to finer granularities with arguments that would numerically overflow saturate to Long.MIN_VALUE if negative or Long.MAX_VALUE if positive.

        For example, to convert 10 kilobytes to bytes, use: ByteUnit.KILOBITS.convert(10, ByteUnit.BITS)

        Parameters:
        sourceCount - the size in the given sourceUnit.
        sourceUnit - the unit of the sourceCount argument.
        Returns:
        the converted size in this unit, or Long.MIN_VALUE if conversion would negatively overflow, or Long.MAX_VALUE if it would positively overflow.

      • toBits

        Parameters:
